Articles.Content: Hmm. I see that for Red Dwarf, but the Doctor never had an H- You just add it cause you like it?
Status please?

Status please?

Asking for progress really isn't going to make it go faster. Don't worry about me dying or anything, It won't happen.

Progress has been pretty good, tedious and slow, but I'm still getting through it. Right now I have to match lighting from one part of the ship to another. I'll have a more finished picture to post later.

Progress has been made on the lower sections. I still need to add some texture to the area, and some more touch-ups, but for the most part it's done

Very shiny big spoon!

I've been for almost 20 years totally in love with the 1701-A.

I've just started learning to use Blender. Maybe one day I'll be able to import one myself.

I've been for almost 20 years totally in love with the 1701-A.

I've just started learning to use Blender. Maybe one day I'll be able to import one myself.

Check the OP, we already have a ToS Enterprise.

I've been for almost 20 years totally in love with the 1701-A.

I've just started learning to use Blender. Maybe one day I'll be able to import one myself.

I'm sure I can make the Enterprise A at some point, but it will be a while, so I encourage you to try. Blender is pretty powerful once you learn some of the basics, and the first few Enterprises are pretty easy because of their well defined parts (saucer, hull, nacelle).

Check the OP, we already have a ToS Enterprise.

Although similar, it's just not the same.

I've got a ton of progress on texturing. Most of the ugly seams are invisible, I just need to finish up one more thing and then I'll do the nacelles and Landing gear, which should be pretty easy.
i'll just leave this here this is my next project (in 2.5m) once i finish my radial parts.
Holy crap yours looks shiny and amazing!

i'll just leave this here this is my next project (in 2.5m) once i finish my radial parts.

That's really good! Obviously your an experienced modeller, and I hope I can one day be at your level. But if that's your next project, why is it almost done? Anyways, I'm excited there's another Trek modeller in the community.

I look forward to it, as well as your other parts!

More like a Phoenix 4.0 (see here, here, here, and here)
please release the current dev version ok?

please release the current dev version ok?

If your asking on Voyager: You've asked way many times before, Starvision will release it when he feels like it.

Phoniex: It's a model. It wouldn't even load into KSP.
Exactly. Be patient, StarVision is a very good modder and he will release it when he feels its ready to be released. Not before. Its better this way, for then we get a good polished release.

thanks for the kind words. And I think I'm willing to make a compromise. Once I've finished everything except the Internal I'll release a little alpha in this thread.

I feel I haven't posted any progress recently, so here's some. The nacelles are pretty much done except for a couple glowy spots, then I'll texture the landing gear. Hopefully I can implement suspension into them with this tutorial.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Nice. Way to appease the mob It will be kinda nice to be able to test it out before the IVA is finished. I'm wondering if I could use the enterprise IVA as a placeholder until Voyager's IVA is done?

I cant even describe to you how excited I am about this MOD. I know it would probably be a completely different MOD but what would it take to make the a battle damaged Voyager AKA "The Year From Hell" Voyager? Anyway good luck and keep up the good work.

Nice. Way to appease the mob It will be kinda nice to be able to test it out before the IVA is finished. I'm wondering if I could use the enterprise IVA as a placeholder until Voyager's IVA is done?

I'll make sure to put it in there when I "release" it.

I cant even describe to you how excited I am about this MOD. I know it would probably be a completely different MOD but what would it take to make the a battle damaged Voyager AKA "The Year From Hell" Voyager? Anyway good luck and keep up the good work.

Glad you're looking forward to it. Creating battle damage shouldn't be too hard, but It probably wouldn't give any depth. I'll have to experiment with it after I finish the basics first.

I've been struggling with a problem for the past few days, but I've now figured it out. The thrust was moving with the Nacelles, so when I throttled up it would be off-balanced and spin crazily. I'm not really sure what to do. Hopefully I can just move some stuff around. Regardless it looks good in game. I just need to finish texturing the landing gear, and fix this thrust bug, then I'll get an alpha up.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Try moving the thrust transform? Make voyager lighter? Ajust angle of thrustTransform?
There's no exhaust plumes, right? Maybe center the thrust on the pylons, not the nacelles themselves?
try making the thrust in the shuttle bay/aft hull centered. and just make the nacelles animated on one button.

The problem is I have to have the Thrust coming from the Nacelles because there is already an engine on the Main hull. It doesn't seem to matter where in the Nacelles part I put the Transform, it still moves. I might try and give it exhaust, then I can debug it easily. I'm sure I'll figure it out.
